legal_basis: Notice is given under section 1 of the Statistics of Trade Act 1947.
title: Monthly Survey of Consumer Credit Grantors

description.text: If the company details or structure have changed contact us on {telephone_number_link} or email {email_link}

list: You have been selected to complete the Monthly Survey of Consumer Credit Grantors.
Data should relate to all sites in England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland unless otherwise stated.
We will treat your data securely and confidentially.
You cannot appeal your selection. Your business was selected to give us a comprehensive view of the UK economy.
You still need to complete this survey even if it does not seem relevant. All returns are important as it helps us produce better statistics.
You can provide informed estimates if actual figures are not available.
You can save or print a copy of your answers for your records at the end of this questionnaire.

contents.description: This survey collects information about consumer credit granted to individuals by non-deposit taking finance houses and other specialist consumer credit grantors based in England, Scotland, Wales, and Northern Ireland. This information is used by the Bank of England in their calculations of consumer credit and contributes to the UK National Accounts.
View more information about this survey (this link opens in a new tab)
The survey has the following sections:
In this section you will be asked to:

list.text: provide information for the period {ref_p_start_date} to {ref_p_end_date}. If you are not able to provide figures for this specific period, then you can select dates up to 14 days before or after the period

list: identify if your business holds a banking license
list the businesses covered by this return

questions.question: All self-financed credit granted to consumers

contents.description: In this section you will be asked to provide information for balances, transactions and movements relating to self-financed credit granted to consumers including:

list: previous credit outstanding
new credit advanced
credit charges earned
repayments received
net loans sold to or bought from another organisation
credit written off
any other movements
total credit outstanding

questions.question: Credit granted on self-financed credit cards

contents.description: In this section you will be asked to provide information for balances, transactions and movements relating to credit granted on self-financed credit cards including:

list: identifying if your business issues its own credit cards using its own funds
previous credit outstanding on credit cards
new credit advanced on credit cards
credit charges earned on credit cards
repayments received relating to credit issued on credit cards
credit card loans sold to or bought from another organisation
credit card credit written off
any other movements relating to credit cards
total credit outstanding on credit cards

contents.description: The figures within this section should be included in your answers in the 'All self-financed credit granted to consumers' section.
Classify store cards as credit cards.
In this section you will be asked to provide comments relating to your return.

list: The information you provide contributes to Gross Domestic Product (this link opens in a new tab)

The information you supply will be used in producing estimates of consumer credit and in measuring the contribution of non-deposit taking finance houses and other specialist consumer credit grantors to the UK National Accounts.

contents.description: In this section you will be asked to:

list.text: provide information for the period {ref_p_start_date} to {ref_p_end_date}. If you are not able to provide figures for this specific period, then you can select dates up to 14 days before or after the period

list: identify if your business holds a banking license
list the businesses covered by this return

title.text: Are you able to report for the period {ref_p_start_date} to {ref_p_end_date}?

options.label: Yes, I can report for this period
options.value: Yes, I can report for this period

options.label: No, I need to report for a different period
options.value: No, I need to report for a different period

in: Yes, I can report for this period

question.title: What dates will your business be reporting for?

description.text: If you are not able to provide figures for the specific period {ref_p_start_date} to {ref_p_end_date}, then you can select dates up to 14 days before or after the period.

question.title: Does your business supply data relating to credit granting activities to the Bank of England, via their surveys?
Provide a list of businesses covered by this return

sections.title: All self-financed credit granted to consumers

blocks.page_title: All self-financed credit granted to consumers

content.title: All self-financed credit granted to consumers

contents.description: This section asks for information about all self-financed credit granted to consumers including:

list: previous credit outstanding
new credit advanced
credit charges earned
repayments received
net loans sold to or bought from another organisation
credit written off
any other movements
total credit outstanding

question.title: At the end of the previous period, what was the amount of credit outstanding?

answers.label: Amount of credit outstanding at the end of the previous period
answers.description: Enter a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000.

title.text: For the period {from} to {to}, what was the amount of new credit advanced?

contents.description: Include:

list: new credit agreements, including those made through a retailer or other agent
full value of renewed or refinanced credit

contents.description: Exclude:

list: all charges

answers.label: Amount of new credit advanced
answers.description: Enter a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000.

question.title: For the reporting period, what were the value of credit charges earned?

contents.description: Include:

list: earnings accrued on all agreements during the period
release of all earnings of fixed-sum, fixed-rate agreements
additional charges on rescheduled agreements
commission

contents.description: Exclude:

list: recoveries of bad debts previously written off

answers.label: Value of credit charges earned
answers.description: Enter a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000.

question.title: For the reporting period, what was the amount of repayments received?

contents.description: Include settlements by means of renewal or refinancing
Exclude recoveries of bad debts previously written off

answers.label: Amount of repayments received
answers.description: Enter a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000.

question.title: For the reporting period, what was the net amount of loans packaged off and sold to or bought from another organisation?

answers.label: Net amount of loans sold to or bought from another organisation
answers.description: Enter a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000.

question.title: For the reporting period, what was the amount of credit written off?

answers.label: Amount of credit written off
answers.description: Enter a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000.

question.title: For the reporting period, what was the value of any other movements not already included in this section?

answers.label: Value of any other movements
answers.description: Enter a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000.

question.title: At the end of the reporting period, what was the total amount of credit outstanding?

description.text:
This should be equal to the total of the following answers:

Amount of credit outstanding at the end of the previous period: {amount_of_credit_outstanding_at_the_end_of_the_previous_period}

Amount of new credit advanced: {amount_of_new_credit_advanced}

Value of credit charges earned: {value_of_credit_charges_earned}

Minus the total of these answers:

Amount of repayments received: {amount_of_repayments_received}

Net amount of loans sold to or bought from another organisation: {net_amount_of_loans_sold_to_or_bought_from_another_organisation}

Amount of credit written off: {amount_of_credit_written_off}

Value of any other movements: {value_of_any_other_movements}

answers.label: Credit outstanding
answers.description: Enter a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000.

sections.title: Credit granted on self-financed credit cards

blocks.page_title: Credit granted on self-financed credit cards

content.title: Credit granted on self-financed credit cards

contents.description: This section asks for information about credit granted on self-financed credit cards including:

list: identifying if your business issues its own credit cards using its own funds
previous credit outstanding on credit cards
new credit advanced on credit cards
credit charges earned on credit cards
repayments received relating to credit issued on credit cards
credit card loans sold to or bought from another organisation
credit card credit written off
any other movements relating to credit cards
total credit outstanding on credit cards

contents.description: The figures within this section should be included in your answers in the 'All self-financed credit granted to consumers' section.
Classify store cards as credit cards.

title.text: Does {ru_name} issue its own credit cards using its own funds?

contents.description: Exclude credit cards provided by a bank or other financial institution

question.title: At the end of the previous period, what was the amount of credit outstanding on these credit cards?

answers.label: Amount of credit outstanding at end of the previous period on credit cards
answers.description: Enter a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000.

title.text: For the period {from} to {to}, what was the amount of new credit advanced on credit cards?

contents.description: Include unauthorised credit on stolen cards

answers.label: Amount of new credit advanced on credit cards
answers.description: Enter a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000.

question.title: For the reporting period, what were the credit charges earned on credit cards?

answers.label: Credit charges earned on credit cards
answers.description: Enter a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000.

blocks.page_title: Credit charges earned on credit cards

question.title: For the reporting period, what was the amount of repayments received relating to credit issued on credit cards?

answers.label: Amount of repayments received relating to credit issued on credit cards
answers.description: Enter a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000.

question.title: For the reporting period, what was the net amount of credit card loans packaged off and sold to, or bought from, another organisation?
description:
Indicate credits with a minus sign.

Classify store cards as credit cards.

answers.label: Net amount of credit card loans sold to or bought from another organisation
answers.description: Enter a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000.

question.title: For the reporting period, what was the amount of credit card credit written off?
description:
Indicate credits with a minus sign.

Classify store cards as credit cards.

contents.description: Include write offs of unauthorised credit on stolen cards

answers.label: Amount of credit card credit written off
answers.description: Enter a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000.

question.title: During the reporting period, what was the value of any other movements relating to credit cards not already included in this section?
description:
Indicate credits with a minus sign.

Classify store cards as credit cards.

answers.label: Value of any other movements relating to credit cards
answers.description: Enter a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000.

question.title: At the end of the reporting period, what was the total amount of credit outstanding on credit cards?

description.text:
This should be equal to the total of the following answers:

Amount of credit outstanding at end of the previous period on credit cards: {amount_of_credit_outstanding_at_end_of_the_previous_period_on_credit_cards}

Amount of new credit advanced on credit cards: {amount_of_new_credit_advanced_on_credit_cards}

Credit charges earned on credit cards: {credit_charges_earned_on_credit_cards}

Minus the total of these answers:

Amount of repayments received relating to credit issued on credit cards: {amount_of_repayments_received_relating_to_credit_issued_on_credit_cards}

Net amount of credit card loans sold to or bought from another organisation: {net_amount_of_credit_card_loans_sold_to_or_bought_from_another_organisation}

Amount of credit card credit written off: {amount_of_credit_card_credit_written_off}

Value of any other movements relating to credit cards: {value_of_any_other_movements_relating_to_credit_cards}

answers.label: Credit outstanding on credit cards
answers.description: Enter a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000.

question.title: Please provide any further details that will help us understand your answers and tell an industry story
description:
Comment on significant movements in data between the current and previous monthly returns. If you provide comments, we are less likely to contact you with data queries.

Make sure you continue to the next page and select submit at the bottom.

contents.description: Include details of any significant changes to the data resulting from changes in accounting approaches you have taken
Learn more about how we use this data (this link opens in a new tab)

submission.title: Check your answers and submit
submission.warning: You must submit this survey to complete it
submission.guidance: You will have the opportunity to view, save or print a copy of your answers after submitting this survey.
